newsitem.title: INDIA: India's HZL zinc and lead prices for March 1997.
newsitem.headline: India's HZL zinc and lead prices for March 1997.

text.p: Following are zinc and lead prices for March 1997 announced by the state-owned Hindustan Zinc Ltd (HZL) and circulated by the Bombay Metals Exchange Ltd.

HZL brand zinc and lead prices, effective March, 1997 and valid till further notice, ex-godowns at Sewree, Thane, Kalamboli, Nagpur, Nanded, Pune, Margao, Goa, Daman, Silvassa and ex-smelters are given below:-

Over and above the basic prices declared above, excise duty of 15 percent (or actuals), as per factory invoice, octroi service charges, octroi duty and sales tax will be charged extra. In case of sale within Goa state, local sales tax of 2.0 percent will be charged extra. If sale is made to customers outside Goa state, CST of 2.0 percent will be levied against submission of CST Form C.

In case of sale within Daman, sales tax will be nil against submission of form 11. Otherwise 6.0 percent tax will be levied if sale is made to customers outside Daman. CST 4.0 percent will be levied against submission of CST Form C. In case of sale within Silvasa sales tax will be nil against submission of Form 11 otherwise 7.0 percent tax will be levied if sale is made to customers outside Silvasa. CST 4.0 percent will be levied against submission OF CST Form C.
* Against advance payment, Pay Order/Demand Draft is to be given.

* Against credit sale, confirmed irrevocable letter of credit payable at Fort/Nariman Point, Mumbai is to be submitted. If any party wants to open L/C payable at Mumbai-suburbs then, it will be the responsibility of the customer to deliver the pay order to our SBBJ Bank at D.N. Road or to HZL, Mumbai office failing which 24 percent interest to be paid by the party.
Please note that the above prices are subject to change without prior notice and price ruling on the date of delivery will be charge, irrespective of the date of making the financial arrangement.
